alert.note: Alert for Clark; Hot Spring; Pike (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 9:43PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Clark, southeastern Pike, western Dallas and southern Hot Spring Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 942 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lofton to near Halfway to 6 miles north of Blevins. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Gurdon... Caddo Valley... Sparkman... Okolona... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Halfway... Crater Of Diamonds State Park... Richwoods... DeGray Lake State Park... Donaldson... Delight... Friendship... Bismarck... Antoine... Billstown... Alpine... Lono... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central and southwestern Arkansas.
